Key Match Events: Paolo Banchero returned from a 34-game absence to nearly lead the Orlando Magic to an upset of the Milwaukee Bucks.
Banchero scored 15 points in the fourth quarter but missed a potential game-tying 3-pointer at the final buzzer.
The Bucks trailed 81-78 heading into the fourth quarter but stormed to the lead behind Giannis Antetokounmpo’s early onslaught.
Orlando refused to cave in as Paolo Banchero returned the favor to the two-time MVP.
Post-Match Reflections: Bucks coach Doc Rivers praised Paolo Banchero's performance, stating, 'He was great. Good to be young. You miss that many games and you come out with 34 points, seven rebounds and I bet he missed five shots he would love to have over again. That was unbelievable by him.'
Others: The Magic hosted the Bucks without Franz Wagner, Mo Wagner, Gary Harris and Jalen Suggs.
Despite missing key players, they nearly pulled off the upset, thanks to Banchero.
Orlando Magic had a 19-15 record without Banchero.
Franz Wagner has not been cleared for contact, Mo Wagner is out for the season following ACL surgery, and Jalen Suggs is indefinitely out with a back strain.
Orlando is desperately hoping Banchero can put them on his back and lead them to a playoff spot.
